metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7479 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
OpenVPN versions before 2.3.15 and before 2.4.2 are vulnerable to reachable assertion when packet-ID counter rolls over resulting into Denial of Service of server by authenticated attacker. It was discovered that OpenVPN improperly triggered an assert when packet ids rolled over. An authenticated remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7479` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.3.10-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> fix needs a87e1431baccd49a9344cfc63ab7446c4317fa2f (2.4) or 5d747770efa0611cc6cfeb6b3a5853bf51046d53 (2.3) as a prequisite

criterions.comment: openvpn package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.10-1ubuntu2.1').
